subject.geographic: No. 133 Baronne Street, New Orleans, La
No. 133 Baronne Street, New Orleans, La

mods.abstract: ONE HUNDRED DOLLARS REWARD. Ranaway from the Subscriber, No. 133 Baronne street, the slave girl named SARAH MARSHALL, about 18 or 20 years of age, very light complexion, blue eyes, straight black hair, of medium size, has one of her upper front teeth slabbed off, and partly decayed. She will pass for a white woman unless closely inspected. She can read and write. When she left she was neatly dressed, with more or less Jewelry. Steamboat and Ship owners and Officers, are cautioned against harboring or receiving said Slave on their vessels under penalty of the law, The above reward will be paid by me to any person or persons who will lodge Slave in any of the City Jails, or deliver her to me at my office. [mh3 tf] THOMAS J. FRISBY.
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
